articles.author: Timothy Aeppel
articles.description: Jason Andringa’s company was part of the stampede of U.S. businesses that built factories in China.
articles.title: Mood swing: Global producers in US hunt for China alternatives

articles.author: Stephen Nellis, Max Cherney
articles.description: Nvidia (NVDA.O) dominates the market for artificial intelligence computing chips. Now it is coming after Intel’s longtime stronghold of personal computers.
articles.title: Exclusive: Nvidia to make Arm-based PC chips in major new challenge to Intel

articles.author: David Shepardson, Joseph White
articles.description: The United Auto Workers (UAW) union struck Chrysler-parent Stellantis's largest assembly plant on Monday, hitting the automaker's profitable RAM 1500 pickup truck production in a major expansion of the more than month-old strike.
articles.title: UAW expands strike against Stellantis, hitting pickup truck plant

articles.author: Hannah Lang, Kanjyik Ghosh
articles.description: Bitcoin, the world's largest cryptocurrency, hit a three-month high on Monday, rising 3.62% to $31,087 amid investor enthusiasm about the possibility of a spot bitcoin exchange-traded fund.
articles.title: Bitcoin hits three-month high, buoying crypto stocks

articles.author: Aditya Soni, David Shepardson
articles.description: The U.S. Justice Department has sought documents and issued subpoenas to Tesla (TSLA.O) as it scrutinizes the automaker's driver assistance system Autopilot and vehicle driving range, among other issues, the company said on Monday.
articles.title: US Justice Department issues subpoenas to Tesla in ongoing probes

articles.author: Byron Kaye
articles.description: Microsoft (MSFT.O) said it will spend A$5 billion ($3.2 billion) expanding its artificial intelligence (AI) and cloud computing abilities in Australia over two years as part of a wide-ranging effort that includes skills training and cyber security.
articles.title: Microsoft to spend $3.2b in Australia as AI regulation looms

articles.author: Valerie Insinna, Mike Stone
articles.description: Lockheed Martin Corp (LMT.N) has withdrawn from the U.S. Air Force's competition to build at least 75 refueling tankers, the company said, giving Boeing's (BA.N) KC-46 Pegasus a boost in the closely watched multi-billion dollar Air Force contract.
articles.title: Exclusive: Lockheed exits US Air Force tanker competition; lifting Boeing's KC-46

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Emily Rose
articles.description: Israel's attacks concentrated on the Gaza Strip's centre and north, Palestinian media reported. A strike on a house near the Jabalia refugee camp, in northern Gaza, killed several Palestinians and wounded others, according to media reports.
articles.title: Israel strikes Gaza, Lebanon overnight; Netanyahu convenes generals

articles.author: Emily Rose, Crispian Balmer
articles.description: As Israel prepares to invade the Gaza Strip, many families of hostages seized by Hamas are pleading with the government to rein in the war effort and instead negotiate the release of their loved ones.
articles.title: Hostage families face appalling dilemma as Gaza invasion looms

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan on Monday submitted a bill approving Sweden's NATO membership bid to parliament for ratification, the presidency said, in a move welcomed by Stockholm that clears the way for it to join the Western defence alliance.
articles.title: Turkey's Erdogan submits Sweden's NATO bid to parliament for ratification -presidency
